country.name: Solomon Islands
country.overview: The Solomon Islands, a nation of hundreds of islands in the South Pacific, has many WWII-era sites. Guadalcanal, a province and one of the archipelago’s largest islands, honors fallen Allied soldiers at its U.S. War Memorial. Guadalcanal is also home to the nation’s capital, Honiara, whose bustling Central Market showcases the islands’ produce and traditional handicrafts.

translations.name: ဆော်လမွန်အိုင်းလန်းနိုင်ငံ
หมู่เกาะโซโลมอน

geography.location_description: Oceania, group of islands in the South Pacific Ocean, east of Papua New Guinea
geography.climate: tropical monsoon; few temperature and weather extremes
geography.terrain: mostly rugged mountains with some low coral atolls
geography.hazards: typhoons, but rarely destructive; geologically active region with frequent earthquakes, tremors, and volcanic activity; tsunamis
geography.notes: strategic location on sea routes between the South Pacific Ocean, the Solomon Sea, and the Coral Sea; on 2 April 2007 an undersea earthquake measuring 8.1 on the Richter scale occurred 345 km WNW of the capital Honiara; the resulting tsunami devastated coastal areas of Western and Choiseul provinces with dozens of deaths and thousands dislocated; the provincial capital of Gizo was especially hard hit
